ygData.subject: C++ NEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey, I haven t written to the group in a long, long time.  But, I ve been working on my own C++ implementation of NEAT for a couple years.  The problem is that

Hey, I haven't written to the group in a long, long time.  But, I've been
working on my own C++ implementation of NEAT for a couple years.  The
problem is that I simply don't have time anymore.  However, it's killing
me that all the work I did do is simply sitting on my drive.  Hopefully
someday I'll be able to finish it all up but in the mean time I thought
I'd send it out in case someone wants to adopt it.  It's actually pretty
far along and, in fact, at one point was pretty much fully functional.  Of
course, not being satisfied, I started rewriting some of the classes and
now it's in a somewhat broken form.  That being said, the core classes
(node, network, genome, etc) I believe to be quite solid and quite fast. 
One cool thing the network class does is print out networks in a form
"viewable" by the graphviz dot program.  At some point I do plan on
writing a front end that allows for "on-the-fly" viewing of the networks. 
I'm just trying to figure a good architecture that won't slow down the
simulation too badly.

Anyway, I'm going to attempt to upload all the source to the yahoo group
under NEAT C++.  If anyone does take a crack at it please drop me a line. 
Alternatively, if anyone looks at it and says, man, that's a bunch of
crap, we've already got stuff way better than this...I'd like to hear that
as well.  Just don't try to convince me that C# is just as good, just as
fast, etc :)

Thanks, best!

- jeff
